chapterTitle: Some Lessons From Capital Market History

columns.text: In this problem, we will use our computational skills to solve for what is asked based on the given data set.

In order to solve for the arithmetic average returns, we can simply add all the returns for X and divide it by the number of years which is $5$.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{arithmetic average returns}&=\dfrac{0.12+0.28+0.09-0.07+0.10}{5}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Add the values in the numerator and divide them by $5$ to get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{arithmetic average returns}&=\dfrac{0.52}{5}\\[15 pt]\\
&=0.104
\end{aligned}$$

The arithmetic average return for X is $10.4\%$

In order to solve for the arithmetic average return for Y, we can simply add all the returns for Y and divide it by the number of years which is $5$.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{arithmetic average returns}&=\dfrac{0.25+0.34+0.13-0.27+0.14}{5}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Add the values in the numerator and divide them by $5$ to get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{arithmetic average returns}&=\dfrac{0.59}{5}\\[15 pt]\\
&=0.118
\end{aligned}$$

The arithmetic average return for Y is $11.8\%$

Solving for the variance of X, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\sigma^{2}&=\dfrac{(0.12-0.104)^2+(0.28-0.104)^2+(0.09-0.104)^2+(-0.07-0.104)^2+(0.10-0.104)^2}{5-1}\\
&=0.01543
\end{aligned}$$
The variance for the values of X is $0.01543$

Solving for the variance of Y, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\sigma^{2}&=\dfrac{(0.25-0.118)^2+(0.34-0.118)^2+(0.13-0.118)^2+(-0.27-0.118)^2+(0.14-0.104)^2}{5-1}\\
&=0.05447
\end{aligned}$$
The variance for the values of Y is $0.05447$
For the standard deviation, we can simply take the square root of the variances.

For the standard deviation of X, we have:

$$\begin{aligned}
\sigma&=\sqrt{0.01543}\\
&=0.1242
\end{aligned}$$

The standard deviation for X is $0.1242$

For the standard deviation of Y, we have:

$$\begin{aligned}
\sigma&=\sqrt{0.05447}\\
&=0.2334
\end{aligned}$$

The standard deviation for Y is $0.2334$
